Pontefract Castle is a castle ruin in the town of Pontefract, in West Yorkshire, England.

name: Sandal Castle
description: Sandal Castle is a ruined medieval castle in Sandal Magna, a suburb of the city of Wakefield in West Yorkshire, England, overlooking the River Calder.

name: Devizes Castle
description: Devizes Castle was a medieval fortification in the town of Devizes, Wiltshire, England, on a site now occupied by a Victorian-era castle.

name: Ludgershall Castle
description: Ludgershall Castle is a ruined 12th-century fortified royal residence at Ludgershall in Wiltshire, England.

name: Old Sarum Castle
description: Old Sarum is the site of the earliest settlement of Salisbury in England.

name: Old Wardour Castle
description: Wardour Castle is a 14th-century castle at Wardour, on the boundaries of Tisbury and Donhead St Andrew in the English county of Wiltshire, about 15 miles west of Salisbury.

name: Caldwall Castle
description: Kidderminster is a historic minster and market town in Worcestershire, England, 17 miles south-west of Birmingham and 15 miles north of Worcester.

name: Hartlebury Castle
description: Hartlebury Castle, a Grade I listed building, near Hartlebury in Worcestershire, central England, was built in the mid-13th century as a fortified manor house, on manorial land earlier given to the Bishop of Worcester by King Burgred of Mercia.

name: Holt Castle
description: Holt Fleet is a village in the Wychavon district of the county of Worcestershire, England.

name: Worcester Castle
description: Worcester Castle was a Norman fortification built between 1068 and 1069 in Worcester, England by Urse d'Abetot on behalf of William the Conqueror.
